description:
The. best. Techno. Nite. 
$5
Slow acid tech
Wednesdays 
Chill crowd, no judgement, no $500 shoes.
author: Sarah F.

description: It was a really cute environment they had a loud dance floor and then a side room for more of an intimate vibe. The bartenders were really nice, it would have been cool if more people had been dancing though instead of just standing around
author: Hadara P.

description: Best place ever! Clearly had a fun night because I lost my phone and Rob (head of security) found it and was amazing at helping me get it back. Also the music was great and the space is awesome. Definitely will go back to this place 10/10
author: Lil E.

description:
I love this place if you are looking to get down on a weekday/sunday with a couple stages and fun music w/ an interesting crowd!

Fun to bring friends in town who complain that there is nothing to do on weekdays or sundays (Monarch is a great spot too) and I really enjoyed myself to be honest! I would go back for sure!
author: Ellie J.

description:
I LOVE IT HERE! I don't understand all the hype behind 1015 Folsom and other bars in the area when THIS IS WHERE IT'S AT. 

I have been coming here a lot lately because they are always having a diverse variety of events! Last week, I saw Candy Rain and this past Friday, they had an art/music event with performance by Pluto Mars and Aux Lord. I have been here for quite a few years and they definitely have increased the quality of their speakers and have hired better bartenders! For such a stand up venue, I am not surprised that they are getting more and more awesome headliners as the years go on! F8 keep doing what you are doing, can't wait to come back!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: Bartenders were super rude and stand-offish. I get that it's a club and they're trying to be quick, but I asked one question about the selection of cider before he rudely barked at me then stormed off. Shrugged it off, whatever. Went to the restrooms - was standing in line when myself and other ~women~ noticed there was a strictly men's restroom then one single all gender restroom. Across the all gender restroom is the staff&talent room. Some lady, who I assume works there, stuck her head out and gave us attitude for talking about the bathroom situation like she was pressed about it??  Obviously customers are confused..? Just messed up customer service all the way around. Even the female staff made me uncomfortable. Wouldn't recommend and not coming back.
author: Gabrielle N.

description: Awesome local spot in a neighborhood that is changing faster than life. Support small business and come here. The door staff are chill and the bartenders are sweet. Props to Demitria for the good vibes, and someone please thank that DJ for the upbeat moving grooves. Cheers!
author: Brian J.

description: I love coming to this Nightclub every Sunday, There's this free drum and bass show that happens every Sunday from 10pm-2am which is called "Stamina Sundays!" I have been coming here for about 1 year now and I always love the vibes and people here for drum and bass! If you're trying to enjoy a nice handcrafted cocktail or beverage, Demetria is always the best at that! She always has a smile and is fast at making your drink! Love her and I also love F8! Besides Drum And Bass, every Wednesday there is Housepitality where it's House Music in Wednesday's! Always fun too if you enjoy house music! On top of that, Tuesday's there is free Hip Hop & RNB with RSVP!! I mean, what can you get more better than this!? A nightclub and a bar with different genres of music being played every other day! Check it out  This is my spot! Like I said, I love the bartenders especially Demetria, and the security as well, including the awesome artists and DJs that come in and make it more of the fun!
author: Lilyette Love G.

description: This is a pretty great spot on Folsom for a night out drinking and dancing with friends. There are DJs at the main stage in front and the back stage. The back room was quite small in my opinion so it was a little difficult to maneuver around, but good thing they had a full service bar in the back. Great music and nice venue, would come back for sure!
author: Nancy L.

description: Fun place on Wednesdays nights for Housepitality! Good vibes all around. Bartenders were fast and friendly. It was a little awkward trying to use the toilet, though. All gender restrooms, which is not the bad part. The one closest to the main floor had no door so when I walked towards the stall to check if it was empty, there was a guy using a urinal when I turned to my left and I bolted because I felt embarrassed I didn't see him when I passed by. My friend and I waited to use the restroom near the back room and we went in at the same time because we didn't want to lose each other if we waited outside by ourselves. However, when we both came out together, everyone was cheering. Some people imaginations, yo. Hahahaha. I had fun that night. I'll try to come again when they play hip hop on the weekends.
author: Alyssa D.

description:
When I'm out not DJin, this is one of my fave spots to go... I know most of the staff and they're all on point; security, bartenders, sound engineer, management, and some of the DJs/promoters. 

Say wassup to Demetria my favorite bartender here if you come by. 

HOUSEPITALITY is also the best party in SF on a Wednesday night
author: chickenskratch x.

description: Alyssa was great. Exceptional service. We booked last minute but Alyssa made sure we had a great Table. Segundo and Arturo with Candy Rain were the best.
author: Jorge A.

description: Small venue playing good music! It wasn't as packed as I typically like, but the crowd is cool and the DJs are usually really good. The music tended towards hip hop when I last went.
author: Vanita C.

description: The crowd here is creepy. Bunch of tweakers. No hot chicks. Don't recommend going here if you are a single dude looking to meet new woman.
author: Michael Anthony M.

description:
I love this place. Stamina Sunday's every Sunday is killer. 
My weekly dose of drum'n'bass. 
Free In the residents are a bit crap. It's like they play the same tracks every week but the headliners are always quality
author: Ken M.

description: The Staff is super nice and the drinks are yummy. I love Hospitality .
author: Kenneth T.

description:
Yikes! Our night was absolutely spoiled by a rude brunette female bartender. It took about 20 minutes to order a drink - seriously. We finally moved to a better spot, and finally got her attention. Busy bar, I get it. What ruined it for me was she took half our order, then told us to wait while she took the order of someone who walked up and waited only ~2 minutes. Now that was intentional!

Cool vibe to the bar. Nice people. Just a bad bartender.

Management, find the brunette girl who was working the front bar at 8:30pm on 9/21 and have a talk with her! Uufdah.
author: Dylan R.

description: I'm thrilled to report that Emily Binder is nothing short of a phenomenal barkeep!! This was my first time at F8; and because of her, it definitely won't be my last! It's nice to go out to a club in SF and come across a bartender that is not only friendly & knowledgeable; but also extremely efficient. I speak from experience as I am actually a bartender myself in Brooklyn, NY. She is without a doubt an HUGE asset to your business and I hope to cross paths with her again soon.
author: John A.

description: Had some dope house music. Bathrooms are single occupancy ones so if you're a girl ....you might be waiting. Two bar areas, one main dancing floor, and the smaller of the two bars is in a smaller room with a different dj. I would go again if i lived in the neighborhood.
author: Zin B.

description:
Originally our crew wanted to go to Raven Bar for a bday celebration, but they were holding the line and some folks went in their earlier saying its pretty bad. 

So we moved the group to F8 and man was the best decision. Good music, Hip Hop all night and a good crowd! Our group had a blast! Drinks were averagely priced. Bartenders were fast and awesome! 

Cover was $10. Definitely coming over for hip hop with the crew!
author: Sunny P.

description: Its okay reminds me of a little hole in the wall after hrs place. Two rooms both playing house music two bars and a bunch of young tator tots bouncing around basically.
author: Demetria B.

description: The club was crackin' good music all night and people just enjoying themselves. Our VIP Hostess was excellent. My only complaint, the club HAS to have a better system for getting into the club ESPECIALLY for VIP guest.
author: Sean L.

description: Cannot have nicer things to say about this place! I lost my entire purse on the night of my best friend's birthday and she also lost her expensive leather jacket and I could not pick it up for 3 days....came in absolutely everything, credit cards, ID, house keys, ray-bans, best friends present, and card were all intact in my purse at coat check with her leather jacket. Aside from having a raging good time here on housepetality Wednesdays, this place is a win any other day of the week as well!! Good people for sure :)
author: Lisa T.

description:
According to the reviews, this place is supposed to have hip hop music. We got there and the place was so empty. There was literally  ONE person dancing. And it was TECHNO. Who listens to that anymore?? 

The entire place is filled with smoke and reeks of marijuana. We had one drink and left.
author: Marci B.

description:
I like F8.
The Staff is super nice and the drinks are yummy. I love Houspitality and Trap City
was probably the most fun Ive ever had at a club..the dancers are insane and
super entertaining! Ive been there for some techno nights that were pretty dead
and another hip hop party where the dj kept stopping the music and talking to the crowd which was kinda bunk.
Also I came for Belly dancing night and that was really fun but ended kinda early.
author: Amanda B.

description: This bar agreed to a commitment with a bar crawl that our group would be allowed until 10 with no cover charge but they changed their mind the night of at 9pm and started charging $15 to get in and were rude about denying the people in our bar crawl. Can't say much about their drinks because they stopped honoring a commitment they made.
author: Natalie L.

description: After a Tuesday Giants game, F8 over Raven for sureee! Raven was playing 70s and 80s and it was dead. Walked over to F8 and sooo glad we did! There's a bar when you walk in, then you walk deeper in to get to the dance floor! 1) they played a mix of old and new hip hop music! 2) NO COVER CHARGE!!! I mean why would you on a damn Tues? 3) it was maybe 3/4 full, however they closed the dance floor's bar (assuming that's only opened weekends?) 4) I was wearing chucks, Lululemon leggings, my Posey jersey and my Giants hat, and they let me in! (B/c it's technically a bar?) 5) contrary, there were patrons all dressed up in heels and dress shirts etc! Deffff coming back if I'm tryna function on a weekday! Hopefully it's hip hop all week!
author: Isabelle C.

description: The music was great but it was unbearably hot inside. If the venue can't invest in basic ventilation then it's not worth going to.
author: Frank L.

description: From what I can remember, this place was off the hook. Beautiful people everywhere, open till 3am. Bouncers weren't ass holes. Two separate DJs playing in different rooms. A must!
author: Ben W.

description:
Oh WHAT A disappointment
I was told we could go here on Tuesday to watch underground nomads. So husband and I made our way here at 8:45 PM . We were asked for $5 entry, i had read that entry was free before 9 and when I said that, they let us in for free! (I can't imagine how they can charge cover for this place)

There were a total of 11 people inside the club ...including the bar tenders
We had food at the bar which was good by the way (wings, mac n cheese) and we got ourselves some drinks..and we waited..and we waited..for over an hour..we asked about when the dance would start and they said soon..

we decided to get the hell out at 10 since def didn't look like anyone was going to be performing..
author: Anju J.

description: God Damn Demitria is a ball buster. That  fkn Turks my world; and my ginger beer! A L O H A
author: Jason L.

description: Demetria is great! I love the ambience. The different lounges packed into one nightclub offer variety. Definitely a favorite when going out in the mission. Very trancy/technoey. Dance till your hearts content.
author: Chandler G.

description:
I was disappointed with F8 because...

1. The venue was way smaller than we thought.
2. The music would make you think "WTF?"

This was our entourage's first stop and I think we made an accidental entrance into this one. We were really pumped to drink and dance! We got in line, paid the fee, and started getting drinks. Once we got our drinks, we went around the area to see how big this place was. We circled the whole place in like 5 seconds.

On top of that, the music was bad. I would describe it as trance...? It sounds like the genre that people listen to when they're high off of something. There was surprisingly a small room in the back and when I went the music was more awful! It sounds like someone putting a pillow over a stereo and it was not pleasuring to the ears. Like, how do you even dance to this type of music?
author: Aj C.

description: Stamina! on Sunday nights!  SF DnB...worth the hour drive for sure.  Its not like the 90s when we had Compound though.  They trying/doing better than anyone else in the area.  I just wish we had DnB here in San Jose though.  Bar is legit...if you get hot go in the room in back on the left side of the club to chill out.
author: Kirk F.

description:
I have been coming to f8, and specifically to Stamina Sundays for the free drum n bass every Sunday, for years. But I have had yet to try the cocktails, even after so many years. I'm not usually a fan of cocktails and oft stick to beer, BUT LET ME TELL YOU! - the Rum Punch is superrrr tasty! Demitria whipped me one up with the quickness and it was gone in half the time*. The bar staff here is lovely, the atmosphere is inviting and situationally-perfect, and I now know, the drinks are fantastic. BOH BOH BOH

*bonus points if you get the d'n'b/half-time reference.
author: Riley R.

description: I love this place! They have great monthly art shows and rotating DJs. My favorite is Friday night happy hour- Demitria is awesome! Her presence at the helm ensures everyone a good time. Everyone there is so cool and friendly
author: Nikki V.

description: Went here once while I visited San Francisco around New Years. There was literally no space for me to dance and the coat check lady lost my coat!
author: Hanifa N.

description: I had never been to F8 until my friend and amazingly talented photographer Gina Barbara showed her pinup/fetish photography here. The venue was chill, good music and good vibes. The bartender Demitria was supercool and friendly. She handled the crowd,singlehandedly, like a pro. I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Amanda S.

description:
God I love this place!!! Honestly great music each time I go for their Wednesday's Housespatality, which is house music all night with no cover before 10 with rvsp. My three star is for the manager and male bartender there who twice skimped me on my drink. The first time I let it ride because he looks so dam pissed behind the bar the second I complained to the other bartender who fixed it and further explained that he was a genius but just grumpy. I wish I didn't get scroned or scammed every time I came here to buy a dam drink but it won't stop me from coming on Wednesdays.

Updated review: I originally rated the bar at a 3 but after some fun times and maybe a little carelessness on my part had lost my jacket and phone. I was quick to contact feight's staff and received an email right away. They have gone above am beyond assisting me with finding it both times ( yes I lost it once then the second was stolen). I was so grateful to their staff and have grown a deeper appreciation for the place. Love the music every night, great vibe and crowd. So happy to be a regular
author: Yesenia S.

description:
F8 has the best music and drinks!  Great prices, bartenders, staff and space.  It's just the right size for the right amount of people.  Most of the time you have the option to sit at the bar and talk with your friends over a drink OR you can get down on the dancefloor which also gets really packed.

I can always count on having a fun night here on any day of the week :)
author: Roe W.

description: F8 is the place for a drink and a dance. It's friendly and not pretentious like so many bars and clubs in San Francisco. Ask for Demitria, she makes a wicked dirty martini and makes you feel at home.
author: David C.

description:
Super awesome staff at a super awesome venue playing super awesome music on super awesome theme nights.

Always been taken care of here.

Fun atmosphere; no bullshit bar.
2 rooms for 2 types of music depending on the night you go.
There's a big emphasis on art here. Lots of art on the wall, live art displays, and handmade jewelry being sold. 
Gogo dancers make you sweat and badass djs make you dance.

Minor gripe is that it's tiny so it gets packed really quickly and gets very hot.

Don't ask for bottle service because they don't do that sh*t here. Get out of here and your uppity needs.

Check it out.
author: Lanie L.

description: would've given 4 stars but 2 stars bc y'all need air conditioning. had to step outside several times to breathe like coming out of water for air.  what a terrible experience
author: Emily Z.

description:
+ Nice staff, bar and door people.
+ Great booking policies and supportive of non-mainstream club nights.
+ Cosy backroom dance floor and bar.
- Management actively censoring criticism about the club online (1 star).
- Crap soundsystem (fix this and you're 4 stars)
- Overcrowds with popular bookings, no room to dance.
- Main dance floor is a long and narrow, feels inhospitable.

F8 is a venue that books a lot of different parties, don't expect a certain kind of music, recently their sound has been quite poor; boomy and muddy. Particularly bad as a lot of the music they cater too is bass heavy electronic music. Sometimes the parties who book bring their own sound system which can make this a 4 star establishment, please fix this F8 and stop d*cking around.
author: Petter H.

description: Spent two consecutive nights partying at this venue and I would definitely come back again the next SF trip. This place is ran like a dive bar, with a side catering to DJ shows. Not to mention they have very reasonable prices for drinks! If you sneak up to the back side of the venue, they even have a private artist lounge area that's open on certain occasions.  Great place when supporting a friend that's DJ'in or just a group of friends that are looking for a club night without the actual club experience.
author: Gary Royale T.

description: I was not feeling this place at all!  The place was way too small and dark for my tastes.  The EDM  that was playing was boring and repetitive.  It just feels like a hangout for stoners and people the low end of the social ladder.  Don't hold your breath for me coming back to this place!
author: Alex W.

description: This place was super chill. A little small but there was another hip hop room in the back. Drinks were priced pretty good and it had an all around good vibe!
author: Cerina G.

description:
F8 - Good place to have a drink and a dance! The bar is separate from two other dance bars and it is literally a maze in there. There is also another room on the right which is a private(?) area for folks to sit and chill out? 

It is not a sprawling place but there is just enough room to enjoy the DJ's mixes - I personally liked one dance area more than the other one. 

The bar tender was friendly, the crowd was cool and we had a swell time!.
author: Aneesh R.

description: Super friendly and nice staff! I called in to check on general stuff and Eyo, the guy who picked up the phone took time to explain things to me. Greatly appreciated! Haven't been to this club but it looks great and I'll definitely visit before I leave California!
author: Jingyu L.

description: Female bartender here was extremely rude when we were trying to decide what we wanted. Bouncer and all other staff were extremely nice. Sorry for the bartender we were taking our time to decide what we wanted because drinks cost money. Wish everyone was as pleasant as the staff that greeted us at the front door.
author: Chlo Chlo C.

description:
This review is for STAMINA SUNDAYS @1192.

Free drum'n'bass weekly??! fyeah.
Great local resident djs like Lukeino and Jamal (of Bachelors of Science) plus an ongoing round of headliners/dnb legends from the uk (and elsewhere)??! :D
a mostly awesome crowd who are just down to dance to dnb? yes.

the door guy/bouncer is always friendly. never had problems with the bartenders. and the people who come out to Stamina are awesome. even when I've gone alone, there have never been guys who try to dance with me without permission and make me feel uncomfortable. 

another cool thing: The person who runs the visuals. Crazy anime and animation films, old esoteric black&white films... sometimes hard to focus on the music when the visuals are so..interesting.

it can be at half capacity on some slow nights, but when there's a well-known headliner, it can get pretty packed and hot in there.
author: Dianne Y.

description: Love this place... so, so much. With no exaggeration, F8 is one is our all time favorite spaces to hang out, listen to amazing Djs, and dance our tails off. F8 is like your best friend-- comfortable, fun, bringing out your wild side but accepting you for who you are. Or maybe I was a little drunk last night at Throwback Thanksgiving. Either way, F8 rocks, hard. Bartenders are outstanding, security is super helpful (not only took care of our coats, but gave us waters on our way out), and venue is intimate but badass. Can't wait for next time.
author: Lemon T.

description:
Expensive drinks, but overall a fun experience. It got INSANELY hot in there, but everyone was dancing around, so it wasn't too bad. I'm sure I'll go back for Stamina Sundays again soon!

Thank you for hosting The Upbeats, F8! It was a life-enriching experience.
author: Julia D.

description: Awesome club for having fun with friends. Wonderful music and plesant atmosphere. Very friendly bartenders. Love this place.
author: Brayden B.

description:
Bold claim: best happy hour in San Francisco. yes, I said it.

Now now, I know what you're thinking... best is subjective.... But my theory holds a lot of weight.

The rundown is such: 

Time- 6 to 9. More like "happy night"
Specials: $3 beers, $3 wells. Got me feelin' some type-a-way.

Most happy hours in the city are from 5-7, or 4-6 but nope, F8 has taken it a step further and pushed it to 9 with some of the best specials in the city.
For good measure, the $3 beers are your standard low ABV% brews: bud light, PBR, Heineken, corona, etc.
The beer snob in me brushed those off and went with a Dogfish Head 90 minute IPA for a whopping $4. This, my friends, is usually a $8 beer. My buddy ordered a chimay for $4 as well. Mind. Blown.

Aside from the drinks, the food menu (albeit simple) was great bar bites. fries, mozzarella sticks, onion rings, franks red hot wings (with an emphasis on the hot) and mac & cheese. We got a few items,  which I guess was from next door, and was all great. The wings were $6 and the fries were $4... both healthy (not literally) servings.

Happy hour aside, the venue may be grimy and divey  but it gets the job done. Great sound system, super nice bartenders and fun crowd. Last night we were there for the TrapSF Trappy Hour and it was a proper way to end the long work day shaking what my mama gave me. At night it can definitely get a little packed but everyone is on a mission to have a damn good time... mission accomplished.

Come in, save some dough, drink some great beers and shake your tail feather. You just can't go wrong on any  level. 

F8, you take the cake for all my happy hour needs.
author: Ryan L.

description:
This review is for STAMINA SUNDAYS!!!

I've lived here for nearly 4 years, I've been looking for people that are involved in the DNB/Jungle music scene. I found a home here at this club night! Everyone here is having a great time! The drinks are priced appropriately and the sound feels like a warm bass blankie wrapped around you! I love the different assortment of people you get each week! People just in from outta town looking to have a good time! This is a great place to get your dance on!

Oh and the beautiful art on the walls!! Simply amazing! This place is enchanted!


Thank you for the great experiences! Heres to many more :)
author: Alexander P.

description:
Good place for those who like to dance salsa.
A nice offer $ 30 for $ 20 (bar).
Enter price is $ 10.
author: Eduard G.

description: F8 great Sunday free DNB!  With an amazing beautiful bartender Demitria. Good peeps, vibes and all around Fun times!
author: Stacey R.

description: Yo Stamina Sundays rock...this is only one place in the city which brings the best DNB stars for free...thanks for supporting this subculture ...
author: George B.

description: I was there with friends (I go everywhere with them). Personally, I liked it, there is present some of the club atmosphere in Prague: smoke, music and design. Drunk couple kokteyley- good. Then they started to drink stronger, a good drink, drink nice music sometimes plays more to techno, sometimes more hip-hop, it depends on when to come. I advise you to go there, if you like hip-hop !! :))
author: Henadzi B.

description: Have tried Housepitality and (Drum 'N Bass) Stamina Sundays quite a few times, and the music/people are top-notch, in that people are almost exclusively here to listen and engage. If it gets too crowded in the main area, check out the room to the left of the male bathroom to get some space. Check 'em out, good (usually free) EDM to be found here!
author: John M.

description:
Stamina Sundays is where it's at!
Music's on point, no cover, amazing visuals, FOG & the vibe is so right.
Had a blast dancing the night away :)
author: Lauren L.

description:
The sound was awful - the wall-to-ceiling mirrors in the main room were rattling during the Omar-S show, audible across the dance floor. Cmon, you know that there's gonna be loud, bass heavy music being played in there...

Crowd tended younger, and distinctly 'clubby'  - girls all dolled up and guys cruising real hard.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I've only been here on Sunday for Stamina Sunday's weekly free dnb event.

But right thur, 4 star worthy: Weekly. Free. Drum and Bass.  There's really no better way to spend a Sunday night. They bring in major talent too. I've seen the amount of headliners here within the last two months that I would hope to have seen in a full year back in Chicago.

The walls host a rotating display of featured artists. Always interesting to see what is next. They have a projector, decent lighting and sound for their size, and another TV where they are bound to be playing some rando visually hilarious movie.

The vibe is great too. Everyone is always dancing and having a good time. Very welcoming.

In short, come here to keep your ears, eyes, and dancing shoes happy while enjoying a bevi (or two if you wanna skip lunch this week- drinks are a tad on the pricey side.)  

See you Sunday!
author: Dana G.

description:
I love this place... I've only come on Tuesdays to support my friend Amar's night (Underground Nomads) and our belly dance community, but one day I plan on making it out on a Sun for DnB night (love that these nights still exist after my beloved Phuturo was laid to rest).
F8 is super chill, no cheap pickup lines in store for you (not on Tuesdays at least), they've got a great sound system and it's perfect for those who just want to dance or chill with their comrades with a nice cold drink in hand, and shoot the sh*t. However, my impetus for writing this review is due to one of the bartenders, Demitria. These days I find it hard not to be greeted with a 'too cool for school' attitude from a lot of bartenders; it must be in vogue to act better than the people you're serving...or maybe the reverse has caused bartenders to act in this manner (douchy customers)...whatever it is...it hasn't affected Demitria. She's laid-back, friendly, very attentive, knows how to make a drink, and is just good ol' fashioned 'awesome'. Thanks Demitria for not being part of the herd! Gives me hope!
author: Olive J.

description: Absolutely one of the best house and hip hop clubs. Candy rain every first and third weekend and housepitality every Wednesday and free drum and bass parties every Sunday. Great staff, great sound and great talent. Check it out.
author: David L.

description: I came here today and received excellent service from the bartender. They also have cool art and music events every week! Come check them out!
author: Jared R.

description: My crew always throws shows at this venue and it is definitely one of my favorites in the city to play at as far as the vibe goes! I love how intimate the place is, the music they bring is wonderful, and I love the art you can find hanging around. The staff are very nice there, and the security guard even walked me around the block to my car when it was late and I was leaving.
author: Lindsey H.

description:
This review is for STAMINA SUNDAYS

Came in from out of town for a friend's birthday on a Sunday. Had no clue where to party on a Sunday night. We stopped by Monarch first because it was closest to our hotel, but we weren't feeling the vibe there. People were stand offish and would not move out of your way when you tried to pass through the room. We decided to check out F8 next and were so glad we did! 

First off, NO COVER! Heck yes, we'll take that. Entered the place and the music was bumpin'. There is a small bar area when you enter and then a small dance floor area to the left as you walk further into the place. 

The vibe was awesome there - friendly, accepting, people who were there to enjoy the music, party and have a good time with no drama or stuffiness.

I gave this place 5 stars because I was so impressed with the level of entertainment we received on a Sunday night and because of the friendly, good vibes put out by the crowd.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
Disco inferno.

There is an amazing disco ball right above the dance floor. Larger in proportion to the club than most places and prone to captivating sparkles.

More hidden but just as important there is a fan off to one side. You'll want to find it as the room gets hot and you get sweaty. Brilliant deep house will do that.

Add good cocktails, an attentive bar staff and a crowd there for the music and you have the makings for a great night out.

Keep on dancing: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V7EfnYwpmOE
author: Jason B.

description:
Came here to ring in 2013 (NYE party).

Also came here to ring in 2010 (NYE party), when it was under different management.

Same venue (possibly redone?).

I had a good time. We got bottle service right next to the DJ, which allowed us to sit. Our personal server was very attentive, refueling our mixers as needed. There was a bouncer close buy checking in every so often, to ensure no table crashers.

We didn't stay too long, as I was 2 days post-wedding. But, in the time I was there, there was nothing negative to say about this venue.
author: Victor C.

description:
Took my Persian friend to Tuesday Belly Dancer night. So much build up to horrific disappointment they didn't dance until 9:45 and they were 2 very short performances. More expressive dance than talented belly dancing. Unamazed after so much benefit of the doubt. I didn't mind paying for the three of us and even gave a Lil extra to support what I thought was advertised, actual talent. 
Put more practice, spirit and time in your performances that would warrant an extra tip , the nerve you have coming round with that bucket after that. I was so ready to praise and share everyone about the Underground Nomads but I don't know now. 

Upside is great food, which stop servong at the bar at 9! And moscow mules were dope. Just go to chat with friends cuz not much else going on here on Tuesdays.
author: Jessica L.

description: Also this place is the spot for the best old fashioned in the city. Really. Demitria hooks it up with the most tasty old fashioned I've had. And that's plenty. Try it when you stop in.
author: Vilen G.

description:
You love to dance and get your swerve on?!?
....but the club and meat market atmosphere aren't your scene??

F8 is the place to be!
An INTIMATE LOUNGE ATMOSPHERE with EXCELLENT DRINK SELECTION and FRIENDLY STAFF.

TOTALLY STOKED ON THIER DANCE FLOOR!!!
A proper dedicated dancing area with STELLAR SOUND and decent lighting.  They always have interesting and MIND MELDING VISUALS being projected too.  **Also to be noted that if there are ever creepy guys bothering me or anyone else on the dance floor that the security staff here are always there to back you up and remove them--never met such PROACTIVE and KIND BOUNCERS!

Their HAPPY HOUR PRICES ARE AWESOME! for an after work cocktail from 5-9pm and it's a more quiet and intimate vibes during those hours... the dancing and lights start closer to 10pm.

Definitely one of my most frequented bars in SF and will continue to be.
author: Wendy C.

description: Excellent dnb vibes on Sunday night. Bartenders are prompt and professional. Shoutout to the bouncer (Rob? ron?) for being the most patient person ever in sticky situations.
author: Therese H.

description:
This review pertains to my experience at the bar at F8, which I now...H8. Went there last night to start off the evening before making the rounds at the local soma watering holes. I had never been here and gave it a shot. Was quickly weired out when someone not "even working" sitting down at the bar carded me, which was fine but at least she was nice about it. The bartender, though a bit surly in her mannerisms , started off strong, getting my drink quickly and following up with a courteous,  "how is it?".

 She then leaves the bar all together leaving a disinterested barback to man the station. A queue for drinks forms but maybe we are supposed to help ourselves? At one point a manager (possibly) comes over and asks "who is working behind the bar?"; still nobody, apparently. The barteneder has left outside to hang with her friends. When she finally saunters back, she makes the rounds but despite my best efforts to make eye contact and polite gestures to call her over I'm completely ignored. The bar is not crowded and has less than 10 people there. She has now gone over to the corner of the bar and proceeds to talk/flirt to her friend for the next 10 minutes.

 After repeated attempts to get her attention, I give up and walk to the barback to get my card. He declines and walks away saying that she has to close out the transaction. I get the protocol, but honestly it seems like nobody is working here. The place is run like a house party with poor taste in music...which of all things was Grime. Grime sounds like two feral cats mattress dancing on a chalkboard and they have razors for claws. The sounds of their mating is then amplified by Daft Punk on cough syrup.  Not good. 

I finally have to physically throw my arms up and say loudly "can I please get my card back?!" I finally do, and it's ok, because no level of pissed off could ruin my love for the revelery and great bartenders of 80's Night at Cat Club next door...
author: Ovidio C.

description:
Always have a good time here, but this time I did not. The rude, self entitled bar tender decided that a Shirley temple (a non alcoholic beverage) cost 3 dollars for every single one, not just the first one (how it is, at every bar) then when I'm trying to speak to my boyfriend about how irritated I was, he preceded to argue with me, not once, but four times. He continually argued and wouldn't quit. I had to tell him I didn't want to hear it. 
Last time I will ever spend money at this bar. 
Rude. 
Unprofessional. 
Great customer service.
author: Molly M.

description: Consistent Housepitality (house / EDM) Wednesday nights. RSVP on their website before 6 p.m. for free entry before 10 p.m.
author: Inigo M.

description: My first trip to San Francisco and I was drawn to the bar in many ways! The name intrigued me ,the music soothed me and Demitria was on point in making me feel welcome! I will be back! Thank you!!!!!!
author: Micah M.

description: Too small... don't go if you're looking for a crazier atmosphere. Very mellow compared to a lot of places. Not worth the cover
author: David B.

description: Last time I came here with a Couple of my friends and we had a blast!!! Dancing until the sun went up! Lol! Always poppin! Plus I loveeeeeee there sushi soooo delicious! I probably come here like once or twice a month! Never get sick of hanging out here.
author: Klarissa J.

description: A place to have a WILD Sunday night has been found! I had friends visiting from abroad who really wanted to go out on a Sunday night, and from past experiences, I really couldn't think of a place to go. Luckily, I turned to yelp, and stumbled upon F8. We can here close to midnight and the place was alive! We had a great time, and the place has a a great $20 for $30 yelp deal (which got us 4 drinks, very reasonable).
author: Nikita K.

description:
Came here randomly on a Saturday night.

If it's hot and humid that only means there's lots of bodies dancing and sweating! If you don't like packed places and body to body, not sure if you will enjoy it. BUT if you're looking for a good diverse dancing environment, have fun! Top 40s and even reggae music. Enjoy yourself :)
author: Rebecca B.

description: We came on a Wednesday night and didn't really enjoy the time here, the music isn't great,so does the crowd. Ambience is like a local bar with very small dance floor.
author: Sandeep L.

description: This bar is the cats meow!! Demitria is the bomb tarbender! Always have the greatest time at this place. Thanks for making top notch cocktails Demetria and being genuinely sweet and attentive. Nothing is better than Stamina Sundays!!
author: Jessica J.

description: Reliably good music and a fun vibe.  Skip the hoochie dress and 6" heels coming here.
author: Michelle R.

description: Love this place.  No attitude, cool people, no pretentious folks.  Always have a great time.  Awesome music and sound.  Great venue for house, techno, and other types of dance music!
author: T. E.

description: First, F8 has by far the best bookings in techno and club music in SF. But beyond that I also had a great experience with the staff this weekend. I came out for AYLI to see Randomer and I'd bought a new pair of pants that hadn't been vetted for raving yet. Turned out the pockets leaked all over the place and I lost a bunch of stuff including credit card and keys. Got ahold of a staff member on Sunday and he was super helpful, and when he got in to the venue he contacted me immediately to let me know my items were there. I went over to retrieve them and tried to tip the woman who was working the bar (Demitria, who I've learned is also Asst. Manager and Art Director), but she refused to take it. Really happy with the service I got and friendly reception every step of the way. It's things like this that keeps a klutz like me coming back, knowing that the venue staff has got my back. A+
author: Tomas H.

description: This review is for Stamina Sundays! It is so much fun! On Sundays there's free entrance, music is on point, there's fog in the dance floor & the staff were friendly. I had a blast yesterday with some of my friends. I highly recommend this place.
author: Maritza S.

description: I had a great experience at this night club. I had dropped my ID and someone returned it to the security team and they found me and gave me back my ID. The hospitality was awesome and the music was rad. Will definitely be going back soon!
author: Shelby B.

description: Wonderful nightclub with a stellar sound system and great DJs coming through.  The place also features some lovely artwork which changes frequently.  Would definitely recommend a visit!
author: Emily B.

description:
I come here twice a week. Once on Wednesdays for Housepitality and again on Sundays for Stamina Sundays. Every week. Here's my opinion:

Pros:
- BOTH nights are FREE (Wednesday is free with w/ RSVP b4 11)
- Almost always a nice, friendly vibe
- 2 rooms (not used on Sunday)
- Decent sound system, if you have ear plugs
- FRIENDLY bouncers and door people... like friendliest i've experienced in the city.
- People going off and dancing ALL night
- WORLD CLASS TALENT... I can't stress this enough.

Cons:
- Sound can be too loud, but more importantly NOT tuned properly so that the highs and mids are physically hurting your ears. EAR PLUGS ARE A MUST. This isn't Monarch.
- Expensive drinks. $10 for a top shelf on ice. I can go down the street to ANY fancy cocktail bar and get a hand-crafted cocktail for $10-$11

That's it. As you can clearly see, the pros outweigh the cons.
author: Johnson M.

description:
This bar/club is definitely on my top 3 places for drum and bass music. Stamina Sundays are usually when you'll find me there, because they always bring in international talent. They also have a LOUD soundsystem, so bring some ear plugs if you plan on dancing in the front (rolled up cocktail napkins work). 

The vibe at these shows are typically pleasant, since we're all there for the same reason. I have made many friends and business contacts from coming here on the right nights. 

The drinks are priced a bit below the neighborhood average, which is good. I'm not sure why, but they don't do my favorite drink special anymore =( jameson shot and PBR for $5. Regardless, I always leave with some cash in my pocket. If you are clubbing on the cheap, there are plenty of liquor stores in the area to get your pre-game going.

One of my favorite parts about this club is its convenient location. 3 blocks from Market, and freeway onramps are close by.
author: Joey M.

description: Great venue and amazing bar. I was well taken care of, as I came in with my motorcycle gear. The drinks were reasonably priced. Demetria is an amazing host. two thumbs up.
author: D A.

description: Came here a few weeks ago for Housepitality, and was super impressed. The girl bartending was very nice and the door people were actually very friendly unlike most places. Great sound and visuals ;)
author: Ben E.

description:
F8 1192 is one of my fav spots nowadays. Music is almost always danceable, and they often have two rooms just in case :P
I love the bartender ladies, always so sweet :)
+gritty dirty dance music uhhhhhhh
+low or no cover
+2 rooms
+thumpin system
+PBR!!! woot!

C yall on the dancefloor, haters can stay home XD TaZ
author: Brian C.

description:
Brought my bf here last night for his bday- nice crowd, free champagne from 9-10 (!!!), good music.  We did use a yelp deal and the bartenders seemed to have no idea what to do with it- hopefully there is just a learning curve there.

But the highlight was, my bag was 'stolen' (like, we looked down, and it was gone) and we went into full panic, looked for it everywhere, informed employees/security, and started to assume the worst.  Their security person took us upstairs where they were reviewing their cameras to see what had happened- like taking it REALLY seriously- and were able to identify a group of (ditzy/drunk) girls who were standing next to us and grabbed my bag as they walked away to the dance floor.  They figured out approx where they set my bag down, and whoever this security guy/hero was went downstairs, retrieved it, and brought it back for me.  

Seriously- their staff turned a costly crisis into a small mishap- REALLY appreciate their commitment to helping out and doing everything they could- thank you!
author: Mana B.

description: I love this place! There is always good nights here but my favorites are Housepetality for sure. The bouncer Rob is someone who is always friendly and professional. He always says hi and is very alert to make sure that if there are "creepers" around he got the ladies covered. LOL Keep up the good vibes guys and gals. :)
author: Charmeelah R.

description: Great intimate bar and lounge in SOMA to catch rare world class acts.  They usually have very niche DJs playing here, so don't be surprised if you see their calendar filled with your favorite obscure artists that you've been trying to see for a long time.  I liked the layout of the place, and liked that the crowd was particularly diverse (maybe because of the DJ playing that night).  The ratio could have been a little better, but I liked that it was not enforced too stringently.  This place seems to be all about the music, and the big room speakers definitely did not disappoint.  The bartenders are friendly, quick, and don't act too pompous or anything.
author: David C.

description: Last night I want to see a Ace Ventura show in F8. It was a lot of fun. The staff was very nice and professional. Good sound system and lighting. Drinks were fair. The only reason I did give this place five stars because they do not have the best ventilation so it gets a bit hot after dancing for a bit.
author: Nate L.

description: While the music was average, Rob made our visit so fun! He let me keep my canned coffee at the door in a safe place (no liquids are allowed into the club). Then he kept an eye on my and my girlfriend. He got us water after the club closed and also brought me my coffee! Without me even asking! Such a sweetheart! Thank you Rob!!!!
author: Valerie V.

description: Recently came here for a Colombian Independence event. The bar is great, kinda bummed there wasn't more dancefloor but overall its amazing!
author: Jen V.

description: One of my favorite places in San Francisco. Nice people, good music. I enjoy so much.
author: Débora S.

description: I went here for the first time last Saturday night for a Honey Soundsystem Event. It was a pretty cool space! The light show on the dance floor was decent and the sound system was pretty good. One real bonus is that the club closes at 4:00 instead of 2:00.
author: Robert F.

description: I'm annoyed with the lack of customer service at this bar. It disgusts me. My husband made an honest mistake in paying for our drinks and when we confronted the bartender about it he didn't even check to see if we were right or wrong. He just brushed is off. I will not come here again.
author: Crystal L.

description: This place is dope.  Every night is musically diverse.  Sound system is top notch.  2 rooms.  Goes past 2am.  Crazy ass movies and visuals always playing.  Lots of drink specials.  Staff and security are all social and friendly.
author: nebakaneza D.

description: I love me some DnB, so when my boyfriend mention a night dedicated to this genre on a Sunday night WITH headliners I was pretty excited to check it out. I have been to this venue quite a few times however it has had a name change since my last visit. One thing about this location that I value is the constant change of art (quality art at that) that they have on the inside. They also had some pretty rad drink specials that I did not partake in because it was my sober night. The vibe was great, sound system was legit and the security guards were not jerks.  All around a welcoming enviorment.
author: Valerie G.

description: Was here on a wednesday, the place is nice and yes for a Wednesday it was busy about 300 people don't quote me. It was busy, drinks were great, and no one had attitude. The owners are super nice, they bought me a drink and chatted me up which is strange to see since usually the vibe at a club is different. The music was booming and not that kind of loud where you go deaf but able to dance and get your groove on. The door people and bartenders are super nice. Great place and I'll definitely be back.
author: Lance T.

description:
I'm not gonna lie, I have friends involved with Stamina Sundays, the free Drum and Bass weekly here at F-8, but this event is REALLY GOOD.

I was skeptical as a DnB fan for years, but these guys get some serious acts in here every week (AK1200, Dara, Klute, etc.) for free.  Not to mention Jamal and Lukeino - the house DJ's - are some of the most skilled DJ's I've heard.  

Big ups F-8 and Stamina Sundays!
author: Ben P.

description: Awesome place... Luke was behind the bar and made us his Lukester special. Good happy hour $3 beers and $5 wells. Good vibes looking forward to checking out more music here.
author: Helen C.

description:
I regularly come to the Sunday DnB events and I ALWAYS have a great time. The music gets you in the mood to dance, the bartenders are super friendly and nice, and the drinks are affordable. Plus, there's no cover! Can't beat that!!

I've also been here on a Friday night to celebrate a friends birthday. We got bottle service and the bartenders kept the drinks coming ALL NIGHT. The bottle service is at the back of the dance floor so you have a comfortable place to chill and relax, or get up and dance.

F8 never disappoints. :)
author: Amber W.

description: Great spot keeping the underground vibe strong
author: Meikee M.

description: This place deserves 6 stars! People working here rock big time. Come on Wednesday nights and get free champagne from 9-10pm. Enjoy the best house music and have lots of fun. Love it
author: Pooria E.

description: Cozy/Intimate venue, friendly security and bar-staff, reasonably priced drinks, and AWESOME D.J.'s!  They've done a great job with this place.  Keep it up F8!  I'll be back often!
author: Michael J.

description: This is by far the best place to see underground dance music. The system is top-notch, only quality DJs are booked, and the staff ROCK.
author: Zachary B.

description: Saturday night. Rude staff, rude cashier, smelly club, not a place that deserves your time or hard earned money.  Skip this place.
author: John S.

description: Came in here on the Sunday night before New Years and were the first people to walk in around 9PM.  The bartender was nice and friendly and made a great drink.  The resident DJ was spinning some fantastic drum & bass so I was happy to stay.  Once it got a bit later into the night the people showed up and the dance floor had a good little crowd going.  I was a fan of this place and will definitely check it out next time I'm in SF.
author: Alex F.

description: Came here on a late weekday after a baseball game and drinks. Was surprised at how many people were around. Drinks are strong but it was nice to find a crowded bar on such a random night. Seems like they have a good crowd every day. Two djs - outside and in - different playlist but essentially the same trance/house vibe.
author: Josh S.

description: F8, formerly Icon Ultra Lounge, is a good stop for free or cheap parties, featuring talented local DJs as well as internationally known acts.  I've enjoyed going on Wednesdays for Housepitality or 3rd Fridays for Freeform vs. Dubalicious.  With two separate rooms featuring different styles of music, as well as a bar area, there is usually plenty of room to dance and socialize, though it can be a little uncomfortable when the venue is crowded due to the multi-room layout.
author: Heidi M.

description: Came here on a Friday night (May 24th) for my graduation party with friends and we had a table with 2 bottles. They were playing House music only and wouldn't take requests, which was a little bit of a downer. The guy I was in contact with about reserving the table (Mitch) was extremely helpful and nice through the entire process. The girl that served us at the table once we arrived (can't remember her name) was super nice and friendly! Staff was very attentive to bringing more mixers and cleaning up the table. The venue is pretty small compared to other "clubs" but it was cool inside. I would definitely come here again!
author: Kristen B.

description: Not exactly the best place in the city to go to. I went on a really dead night for some reason. I had to pay a $10 cover even though i was on the guest list? the bar is pretty expensive too. Go somewhere else if you want to have a night out.
author: Patrick R.

description: We stumbled into this place while walking by on our way to meet friends for dinner.  It was early and there was a great neighborhood feel.  People were drinking champagne - the bartender was sweet and attentive and even passed out little cookies to everyone.  A dj was just getting started - a mix of techno and some old school hip hop.  After dinner I went back to my car - flat tire.  A nice man was walking by and trying to give me directions to a gas station - I was in a rush because the GG bridge was closing for the weekend and I needed to get across.  Rob Hardy took one look at me and began going to work on my tire.  He changed my flat and refused to take any money - a real man does not take money from a lady in distress - well I found out Rob works at F8 where we had been earlier!  I will return to this bar for the drinks and music but also because men like Rob renew my faith in mankind.  This bar is for real.
author: Christie A.

description: I really love this venue. They have a lot of really good shows. The folks from RESONATE always bring out some of the best beatsmiths and DJs from all over California to come up and perform. They have a main dance floor, and a back room. Cover is usually really cheap or free, and parking usually isn't a problem within the area.
author: Jay A.

description: Fantastic place. Always good music, come on Wednesday and Sunday nights to dance your ass off with a great crowd. Bartenders are super friendly, especially Demitria. Drinks are on point and there's always sick new art rolling through. Rob is a great bouncer too, always looking out for the ladies!
author: Alex D.

description: Good sound, good people who love music.  bouncer isn't a jerk, that is always nice! I particularly love the deep bass when its Stamina Sundays (free drum and bass, even the big names!).
author: Martijn M.

description: Sunday at 1192 Folsom is my favorite night of the week!  You can see some top notch acts without a huge crowd of douche bags.   Come to think of it, I get hit on by creeps the least on this night!  Fun times dancing every Sunday I manage to get there.  If you don't like dancing to electronic music, you should probably not go...everyone else DON'T MISS IT!
author: Alexana W.

description: I was in charged of a lot of precious jewels by Nova Scotia Smith (the Canadian version of Indiana Jones) I put them all in my backpack and the absolutely wonderful bar tender Christine kept all the jewel thieves at bay. Even when my sworn nemesis Dastardio D. Mustache came in demanding all the backpacks behind the bar Christine told him to fuck off. He threw his burlap sack with a dollar sign on it on the ground he declared "Drat, foiled again, this is not the last you have seen Dastardio D. Mustache" as he went away in his blimp in the shape of his face while twirling his mustache and laughing maniacally. But even in the face of this villainy Christine managed to keep an amazing atmosphere of top notch service and a help contribute to the friendly environment that this bar provided. As a person who has observed the many MANY conflicts of the Middle East during the failed peace talks between the State of Israel and the Palestinian Authority one of the few things that Israeli Prime Minister Benyamin Netanyahu and Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas could agree on is the top notch service that Christine of 1192 Folsom provided. While in Mosel, Iraq and Ar-Raqqa, Syria and Kano, Nigeria militants in The Islamic State aka Daesh aka ISIS and the Boko Haram have declared their disdain for Christine and her amazing service, therefore to not think that she deserves a raise is to support ISIS and the Boko Haram, for real doh, this bar rocks and I want the people in charge to know that this girl rocks and she has done an amazing job as bar tender!
author: Max F.
